turns.content: Can you suggest some traditional Austrian dishes and where to try them?

1. Wiener Schnitzel - Breaded and fried veal cutlet. You can try this dish at Figlmüller in Vienna. 

2. Tafelspitz - Boiled beef in broth served with vegetables and apple horseradish. It is a popular dish in Vienna and can be found in many traditional restaurants such as Plachutta. 

3. Kaiserschmarrn - A sweet dessert made of shredded pancakes with raisins and served with fruit compote. You can try this dish at Cafe Hawelka in Vienna. 

4. Knödel - A dumpling made of flour, potatoes, or bread and usually served in a soup or as a side dish. You can taste Knödel at Zum fidelen Affen in Salzburg. 

5. Linzer Torte - A sweet pastry made of buttery crust filled with raspberry jam and topped with lattice crust. You can try this dish at K.u.K. Hofzuckerbäckerei Demel in Vienna. 

6. Gulasch - A stew made of beef, paprika, onions, and peppers. You can try this dish at Cafe Sperl in Vienna. 

7. Schweinshaxe - Roasted pork knuckle served with potato dumplings and sauerkraut. You can try this dish at Bier und Bierli in Vienna. 

8. Apfelstrudel - A pastry made of flaky dough filled with tart apples, raisins, and cinnamon. You can try this dish at Cafe Central in Vienna. 

9. Kasnocken - A dish made of small dumplings with a cheesy sauce, often served with fried onions. You can try this dish at Gasthof Schützenhof in Salzburg. 

10. Salzburger Nockerl - A sweet souffle-like dessert made of egg white, sugar, and vanilla, and served with berry sauce. You can taste this dish at Stiftskeller St. Peter in Salzburg.

Yes! Graz has a great food scene and there are many traditional restaurants where you can try Austrian dishes. Here are some recommendations:

1. Gasthaus Zum Lindenhof - This family-run restaurant is located in the historic center of Graz and serves traditional Austrian dishes such as Schnitzel, Tafelspitz, and Goulash.

2. Restaurant Augarten - This restaurant is known for its excellent traditional Austrian cuisine, including dishes such as Knödel, Schweinsbraten, and Kaiserschmarrn.

3. Restaurant Der Steirer - This restaurant offers a modern twist on traditional Styrian cuisine, using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. Be sure to try the pumpkin cream soup, a signature dish of the region.

4. Gasthaus Puntigam - Located in the Puntigam district of Graz, this restaurant serves hearty, rustic Austrian dishes such as roasted pork with dumplings and sauerkraut.

5. Zum Guten Hirten - This cozy restaurant is popular with locals and serves traditional Austrian cuisine with a focus on organic, seasonal ingredients. Try the Wiener Schnitzel, which is made with veal from local farms.

I hope this helps and enjoy your trip to Austria!
